pip – update all outdated packages at once

08 Aug 2017

A quick one: Ever wanted to update all your outdated pip packages and wondered why there isn’t an easy solution built in? Well, try this in your shell: pip list -o | cut -d " " -f 1 | tail -n +3 | xargs pip install -U (thx Jermic)

Works on mac and at least with my Python 3.6.
